Codelabs: Polymer

Ralph Regalado Polymer, De La Salle University

Firebase

Language: en Complexity: Beginner

Build cross-platform native mobile and web apps with our Android, iOS, and JavaScript SDKs. You can also connect Firebase to your existing backend using our server-side libraries or our REST API.

Albert Padin Firebase, sym.ph

Cross-Platform Mobile Development

Language: en Complexity: Beginner

Dan Albert Pacquiao Cross-Platform Mobile Development, Cleversoft, Inc.

Dan Pacquiao is a developer by profession and currently the Vice President of Cleversoft, Inc. -- the research and development arm of Visp.net. He is affiliated with DevCon, Java Dev Knots-ITG, CDO-ICT Business Council, ITG-X, and Google Developers Group. Apart from developing apps, softwares, and websites, he finds his passion in blogging and photography during his free time.

Codelabs: Python + Google Calendar API

Language: en Complexity: Beginner

Learn more about python. Be sure to attend this Code Lab Session.

Romar Micabalo DevOps Sysadmin, Innovuze Solutions, Inc.

Information Technology Group - Region X

Google Communities

Language: en Complexity: none

This session is all about the Google community updates. Representatives from Google Developer Group Sub-Chapters will share their experiences.

Codelabs: Arduino/Adafruit Gemma

Language: en Complexity: Beginner

Hands-on with Adafruit's Gemma Kit, a DIY wearable kit.

Josan Astrid Dometita Community Manager, UI/UX Designer, GDG Cagayan de Oro, Aestrea Software Development

Google Developer Group Information Technology Group - Region X

Josan Astrid Dometita is an HTML5 enthusiast and the Google Developer Group Community Manager for Cagayan de Oro City. Having the interest in the complex ins and outs of computer technology made her earn her Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, with a major in Software Engineering. While still in school, she started freelancing online as a web developer, and expanded her portfolio of skills to become a vector artist and motion graphics animator. She started working as a Multimedia Developer in Manila and together with her friends, then built their own consulting and startup company, Aestrea Software Development, where she is the Creative Director. She calls herself codesigner (coder/designer), a hybrid name that could best describe her skill set, bridging the gap between both the design and development worlds.
